@tyb97 wrote:

Since your doing a 474, and I’m doing a 317, the packets are a bit different. So how would you set the position? Take a look at this to see the packet I’m trying to use, http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317:Show_interface

Read full topic

item.title: [Hyperion] Interface Opening
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Mine is like so:

public ActionSender sendInterface(int windowId, int position, int interfaceId, boolean walkable) {
        if (windowId == Constants.MAIN_WINDOW && position == Constants.GAME_WINDOW) {
            player.getInterfaceState().interfaceOpened(interfaceId, walkable);
        }
        PacketBuilder pb = new PacketBuilder(17);
        pb.putByteA((byte) (walkable ? 1 : 0));
        pb.putLEShort(interfaceId);
        pb.putShort(position);
        pb.putShort(windowId);
        player.write(pb.toPacket());
        return this;
    }

Maybe you need to define a position for it to display at? Not sure if this is essential for Hyperion or just a feature mine has.

You’re doing well, keep at this, even if it gets tough. Sometimes it can take a couple of days for you to come away and take another look at the problem, after you’ve refreshed your mind.

Trial and error.

Read full topic

item.title: [Hyperion] Interface Opening
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ok, so I have been trying to make interfaces open on my Hyperion, I wrote this method in the ActionSender class,

	public ActionSender sendInterface(int interfaceId) {
		PacketBuilder bldr = new PacketBuilder(97);
		bldr.putShort(interfaceId);
		player.write(bldr.toPacket());
		return this;
	}

I got the info for the packet from here: http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317:Show_interface
I am trying to open it through a command,

			case "interface":
				player.getActionSender().sendInterface(Integer.parseInt(args[1]));
				break;

Any ideas?

Read full topic
